item.title: All Fours
item.description:
内容简介 · · · · · ·

July’s second novel, which follows a married mother and artist who derails a solo cross-country road trip by checking into a motel close to home and starting an affair with a younger rental-car worker, was the year’s literary conversation piece, dubbed “the talk of every group text — at least every group text composed of women over 40” and “the first great perimenopause novel” in just two of many articles that wrestled with its themes. Sexually frank and laced with the novelist’s loopy humor, the book ends up posing that most universal question: What would you risk to change your life?

item.title: At Home: A Short History of Private Life
item.description:
内容简介 · · · · · ·

“房屋不是逃避历史的避难所。而是历史的归宿。”

比尔·布莱森和他的家人住在英格兰某地一座维多利亚风格的牧师住宅里，自从罗马人撤离后，这里就再没有发生过什么重大事件。然而有一天，他开始思考，自己对这座舒适的房子里日常生活的了解是多么的少。为了解决这个问题，他萌生了一个主意，在家里一个个房间走访，以“足不出户写一部世界史”。浴室为我们讲述了卫生史；卧室、性、死亡和睡眠；厨房、营养和香料贸易；等等，布莱森向我们展示了每一件事在私人生活演变中扮演的角色。他证明，世界上发生的一切都会出现在我们的房子里，进入油漆、管道、枕头和每一件家具中。

作者简介 · · · · · ·

William McGuire “Bill” Bryson, OBE, FRS was born in Des Moines, Iowa, in 1951. He settled in England in 1977, and worked in journalism until he became a full time writer. He lived for many years with his English wife and four children in North Yorkshire. He and his family then moved to New Hampshire in America for a few years, but they have now returned to live in the UK.
